A/S /I e-t Q Â» k C
January 25f 1955
Mr. Jack K. Westbrook
Chairman, NAEB Acceptance Committee
Radio Station WUOT
University of Tennessee
Box 8540
Knoxville, Tennessee}
Dear Mr. westbrookt
n
I should like to vote yes for continuing the following series*
STORIES N STUFF, University of CHICAGO ROUNDTABLE, and CHILDRENfS
CIRCLE. I think ROUNDTABLE and CIRCLE are particularly valuable to
the network. We dropped STORIES N STUFF at KUSD chiefly because
we wished our children's programs to have more local interest. They
are too, I believe, -just a trifle precious *
I should like also to vote ypm/toT the series SCHOOLS TODAY.
The two I heard indicated sound planning and production on the part
of the people doing the series. I think it has enough universality
in the problems discussed to make thi#/#eries of value to the entire
network. ^
I am entirely in sympathy with the idea behind the program RARE
EDITIONS. Unfortunately, the treatment in the program I heard was a
little dull. It seems to me that a- subject of this kind could be
approached from another more entertaining way and still achieve the
same result. I have ajso been opposed to assertoric groups discussing
something close to their heart# in a way that lacks broad appeal.
For the time being, I wil^ have to say no on RARE EDITIONS.
- THE AMERICAN TRADITION OF ART gets a yes vote from me but with
some reservations. Here again, the talk tends to bog down occasionally
Furthermore, I would like some sort of introduction other than the
one provided on the tape. Possibly, each station is to provide its
own. Nonetheless, I was unable to discern any sort of introduction
and I think it should have one. Finally, I believe the treatment is
just a little dull and the longer I listened, the more this fellow
sort of grew on me. The subject is of real merit and while his
personality grew on me slowly, it grew steadily. I think this brings
me up to date. Best wishes.
Sincerely,
JS/eg
c.c. to John Holt
Jim Slack
Manager, KUSD
